page.title: 19SECTION OF AIRE VALLEY(CONT)
page.content: THE R.AIRE,AND MAIN ELECTRICITY PYLONS.ONCE ACROSS THE RIVER WE PASS THROUGH THE GROUNDS OF KIRKSTALL ABBEY,THE HOME OF THE CISTERCIAN MONKS FROM 1150 TO 1539(DISSOLUTION OF THE MONASTERIES).RISING STEEPLY OUR LINE OF CROSS-SECTION PASSES THROUGH THE ABBEY HOUSE MUSEUM AND ONTO A BRANCH RAILWAY LINE.APPROXIMATELY 500MTS FROM HERE THE LAND RISES STEEPLY TO 115MTS ABOVE SEA LEVEL TO THE BECKETT PARK SITE OF LEEDS POLYTECHNIC,FORMERLY CITY OF LEEDS AND CARNEGIE COLLEGE OF EDUCATION.NEXT TO THE POLYTECHNIC SITE IS A MAJOR WATER-TREATMENT WORKS OF THE YORKSHIRE WATER AUTHORITY.ONCE PASSED HERE WE COME INTO MORE OPEN COUNTRYSIDE WITH LARGE DETATCHED RESIDENCES.A FAR CRY FROM THE SANDFORD ESTATE.THE SECTION ENDS BY LOOSING HEIGHT AND DROPS INTO THE VALLEY OF THE MEANWOOD BECK(STREAM).
